Key Match Events: Michael Toglia had three hits and two RBIs
Ezequiel Tovar had a two-run, game-tying double in the eighth inning
Mack McMahons double brought home Tovar for the eventual winning run
Ryan McMahon entered the game hitting just.192 in 54 games since he was Colorado’s lone representative at the All-Star Game
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon had three RBIs and three runs in one of the final games of his professional career
Aaron Schunk finished with two hits
Mike Trout hit a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning (not in the article)
Blackmon’s two-run home run in the second inning was the 227th of his 14-year career, tying Carlos Gonzalez for the fifth in franchise history
Blackmon’s three RBIs were his most in a game since May 27
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blackmon’s father threw out the game's ceremonial first pitch, a strike
The Rockies will need to win two out of three games against the Los Angeles Dodgers this weekend to avoid the second 100-loss season in the franchise's 31-year history
Paul Goldschmidt hit his 22nd home run of the season, a 457-foot solo shot to center field in the first inning that snapped a 19-game drought without a homer
Others: Angel Chivilli (2-3) picked up the win for the Rockies
Ryan Fernandez (1-6) took the loss for St. Louis
Seth Halvorsen pitched a scoreless ninth inning for his second save of the season
Lars Nootbaar had two hits and two RBIs
Pedro Pagés and Ivan Herrera also homered for the Cardinals
